testcase.name: Creating a new user successfully
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Creating a new user successfully Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I create a user with the following information ... passed in 0.294s | username | email | password | cpf | | newuser | newuser@example.com | Password1! | 11122233344 | Then the user creation should be successful ... passed in 0.000s And the response should include the user details ... passed in 0.000s And the password should not be included in the response ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Attempting to create a user with an existing CPF
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Attempting to create a user with an existing CPF Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I create a user with the following information ... passed in 0.002s | username | email | password | cpf | | copycat | copy@example.com | Password1! | 12345678901 | Then the user creation should fail ... passed in 0.000s And the user error message should contain "User already exists" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Retrieving a user by ID
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Retrieving a user by ID Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I request the user with ID 1 ... passed in 0.001s Then the request should be successful ... passed in 0.000s And the response should include user details for "user1" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Retrieving a user by CPF
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Retrieving a user by CPF Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I request the user with CPF "98765432101" ... passed in 0.001s Then the request should be successful ... passed in 0.000s And the response should include user details for "user2" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Retrieving a non-existent user
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Retrieving a non-existent user Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I request the user with ID 999 ... passed in 0.001s Then the request should fail ... passed in 0.000s And the user error message should contain "User not found" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Updating a user's information
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Updating a user's information Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I update user with ID 1 with the following information ... passed in 0.062s | username | email | password | cpf | | updated1 | updated1@example.com | NewPassword1! | 12345678901 | Then the user update should be successful ... passed in 0.000s And the response should include the updated user details ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Deleting a user
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Deleting a user Given the system has these existing users ... passed in 0.000s | id | username | email | cpf | | 1 | user1 | user1@example.com | 12345678901 | | 2 | user2 | user2@example.com | 98765432101 | When I delete the user with ID 2 ... passed in 0.001s Then the user deletion should be successful ... passed in 0.000s And a confirmation message should be returned ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
